meanings.definition: Make a bubbling sound while flowing.
meanings.sent1: The stream was guggling as it flowed over the rocks.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the water guggling in the creek nearby.
meanings.sent3: The baby found the guggling brook very amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter guggled out like a bubbling brook.
meanings.sent5: The guggling of the water was a soothing lullaby.

meanings.sent1: The teapot started guggling when the water boiled.
meanings.sent2: The drain was guggling as the water went down.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine made a strange guggling noise.
meanings.sent4: His stomach guggled loudly after drinking the soda.
meanings.sent5: The guggling of the coffee machine signaled it was ready.

meanings.definition: The act of making a gurgling sound.
meanings.sent1: The guggling of the river was a peaceful sound.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't sleep because of the loud guggling in the pipes.
meanings.sent3: The baby's guggling was music to everyone's ears.
meanings.sent4: The guggling of the coffee pot was a morning ritual.
meanings.sent5: The guggling of the fountain added a serene atmosphere.
